section.para: The Central Cities are the largest urban centers in &nation_name;. They represent the peak of culture and progress in the nation, and each of them has developed their own unique culture and specialties over time.

sidebar.para: Although they may not be specifically called out in these sections, you can expect most government agencies that deal with infrastructure to have representation in all large settlements. This includes, but is not limited to, divisions such as the &police;, &public_works;, and other servants of the common good.

section.para: Brimming with life and activity, the city of &arts_city; is the veritable pulse of &nation_name;. Artists and entertainers from all walks of life flock to the city to join in the cultural melting pot and experience the wealth &arts_city; has to offer. Anywhere is a stage, and revelry spills out into the streets, infusing the city with a constant state of festivity. Each day could bring new celebrations replete with performances and displays unlike any seen before it. As a result, &arts_city; is a hot spot for tourists from around the world, and their presence ensures that there is plenty of gold to keep the entertainers at their antics.

Officials long gave up on imposing bureaucracy upon the citizens, and now simply seek to ensure that the city runs smoothly from one performance to the next. The last vestige of control the government maintains over the celebrations is the &festival_agency;, which stages city-wide festivals, schedules access to large venues such as &stadium;, and provides publicity for ambitious performers. The &police; patrols the streets, keeping the city safe for residents and tourists alike, but their presence is understated and does not impinge on the city's carefree atmosphere. Petty crime is uncommon, and offenders are swiftly swept to the nearest police station or courthouse for judgement.

Despite the apparent laissez-faire attitude of the government, &arts_city; is extremely well-maintained. Buildings of sturdy wood and cut stone stand strong against the neverending flow of residents, and paved streets make for easy transport around the city. Lights both magical and mundane line the streets and buildings, vying for the attention of passersby. Even with messy tourists who care not for the city's cleanliness, strong sewers and trash removal systems sweep away the filth and leave the city ready for the festivities to continue.

listitem.para: Rows of enormous amethyst crystals jutting from the entrance give &arts_city;'s premier amphitheater it's name. Although its appearance and sublime acoustics would suggest a man-made structure, &hitheater; is actually a naturally occurring geode phenomenon. Performing even once in the &hitheater; is the goal of many artists, and competition is fierce. The revered &auditioners; are the final elite arbiters of who will be graced by the stage.

Vivid botanical gardens and serene marble galleries compose the nation's premier temple of Shelyn. The temple is built on the edge of the city and situated near the &hitheater; so that the clergy may more easily tend to the amphitheater. Compared to the intensity of the city, &shelyn_temple; is truly a sanctuary for those who wish to reflect upon the spiritual impact of the arts.

&arts_college; is one of the world's most prestigious schools for the fine arts, and a central location for both prospective students and tourists alike. Although its intimidating spires, sharply slanted rooftops, and aged stone walls cast an imposing shadow, they belie the energy within. Its campus buzzes jovially at all hours of the day as some of the greatest creative geniuses from around the globe hone their skills.

Named for the carpet of small purple flowers that blooms in the spring, the &stadium; is an expansive, open-air park and a prime location for many public events. Complete with several small venues for performances as well as a large stadium, the &stadium; boasts ample space and seating for tourists and citizens alike. Whether it be music, sports, or festivals, an event in the &stadium; is sure to be lively and draw a large crowd.

Spanning the &arts_city_river; River and joining the east and west of &arts_city; together, the &bridge; is more than just an important piece of infrastructure. Many bits of &arts_city; culture have incoporated the &bridge;, from tossing flowers into the river below for good luck to being a hotspot for watching fireworks. More practically, it's also a natural chokepoint for traffic through the city and its wide stone path is filled with street performers, each trying to take advantage of their captive audiences.

A large stone carving of a frothing mug adorns the facade of &arts_city;'s favorite temple to the god of drinking and merriment. This multi-story wood and stone building radiates a warmth and festivity that can be felt from blocks away. The temple hosts a stage and doubles as both a comedy house and theater for celebrations of bravey, and its walls reverberate with laughter and cheers. To the confusion of tourists and the amusement of locals, the interior of the temple is themed as a bank.

Surrounding &arts_city;'s central plazas, this bustling district is a hotspot for tourism and revelry. Although most come to the district to be at the center of the city's constant festivals, the competition between enterprises to garner attention has changed the district into a spectacle in its own right. Themed businesses, wild street performers, and garish decorations all lend a hand in creating the district's unique atmosphere.

Fed by the youthful, creative energies of the &arts_college;, the &arts_city_college_district; is the premiere place to scout rising talent and share ideas in the city. Although not as upscale as some parts of &arts_city;, the inhabitants of the district are jovial and create a welcoming atmosphere. Collaboration and competition go hand-in-hand here, and it's very likely to see spontaneous performances erupt in the persuit of great art.

Mostly separated from the hustle and bustle of the city, the &arts_city_rich_district; provides a serene place for those who can afford it. Residents and visitors enjoy beautiful courtyards, spotless streets, and exclusively close access to iconic locations such as &hitheater; and &shelyn_temple;.

To call &arts_city_poor_district; a slum would be disingenuous, but compared to the rest of &arts_city; this district falls behind in upkeep and cleanliness. Tenement housing is plentiful, and in lieu of access to more fanciful pursuits, the residents of &arts_city_poor_district; excel in vice entertainment. Seedy bars and brothels adorn the streets, and the venues host bawdy and burlesque performances too vulgar for popular taste.
Tucked away in a less-noticeable portion of the city, &arts_city_govt_district; houses offices and storage for government agencies such as the &police; and &festival_agency;.

Many master craftsmen who outfit &arts_city; with superior quality instruments and supplies base their workshops in &arts_city_quality_district;. These great makers demand a particular environment for their work, and the district has molded to reflect their tastes. Simple, refined architecture and narrow cobbled streets give the district a historic atmosphere, and even the wildest of locals calm themselves out of respect when in the area.

section.para: Words and noise blend with the clink of coins in the vibrant market city of &market_city;. Known for its unparalleled selection of exotic goods, which harken both to cultures from around the world and at the same time something completely original, &market_city; is a haven for craftsmen. The best of the best travel here to study with other masters from all around. The result is a forge of rivalries and collaborations which drive the innovations of these ambitious creators ever foward. Their work and success have brought incredibly reknown to both &market_city; and the nation as a whole, and wealth naturally flows to the city in the form of hardened merchants and more casual buyers.

The siren call of wealth and skill brings along with it much more strict government oversight. Left to their own devices, foreign merchants would surely bleed the country dry. In response, agencies such as the &customs_dept; and the &labor_dept; keep close watch on the conditions of the city. Given the amount of coin that flows through the streets, the &police; are omnipresent in &market_city;, ensuring that the city retains its name as a safe and reputable haven for trade.

The master craftsmen themselves are no pushovers either. Crafting guilds are strictly forbidden both in a legal sense and a communal one, as each individual crafter vies for the reputation of her own name. Consequently, mutual respect—even among the most obvious of rivals—is paramount and palpable in the transactions that take place here.

To feed the high demand of buyers, &market_city; has built itself up around a system of attractive and efficient roads and neighborhoods. No space is wasted in thoroughfares large or small, as every bit of available wall space is transformed into a storefront or workshop. Sturdy stone buildings resist wear from unending shoppers, but also from nature's harshness and the occasional workshop fire. Goods transit smoothly through the city's wide, paved streets, their navigation made easy by numerous road markers. At night, hanging iron lamps illuminate the city's famous twenty-four hour markets.

listitem.para: Thousands of shoppers browse the rows of tents that fill this enormous open-air market. As one of &market_city;'s internationally iconic features, the &grand_bazaar; is home to all sorts of novelties and unique items. Although locally regarded as more for show than function, it is not unheard of to find true treasures nestled in the wares here.

Dozens of imposing wooden boards line the walls of this large forum, each filled with statistics and predictions for various market goods. Harried merchant apprentices hustle along the walls with tablets and chalk in an unending effort to keep the boards up to date. Meanwhile, cold faced merchants and crafters eye the ever changing boards like vipers ready to strike.

&elven_enclave; is &nation_name;'s largest single home of elves. Here they have fostered a small forest grove and made their homes in its trunks and boughs. Elves, Half-Elves, and fey races are openly welcomed, but most others find themselves loosely tolerated as permanent residents.

Not to be outdone by the forest of &elven_enclave; or the cut stone of &market_city; itself, the Dwarves constructed a miniature mountainscape out of boulders from the nation's mines. Now complete complete with carved homes and bold designs, &dwarven_enclave; is a colony in its own right. Although legally no citizen may be forbidden residence here, most non-Dwarves find the stony, cramped interior unwelcoming.

section.para: At the heart of &nation_name; is the nation's crown jewel: the capital city of &law_city;. Towering, gleaming buildings of marble and polished stone strike a grand vista for those who first lay eyes upon the city. Impressive grids of streets and avenues bustle with activity, feeding the machine that runs the nation. At night, although the streets die down to dim illumination by heavy iron lamps, the work of the city does not cease. Buildings big and small come to life as interior lights shine through their windows, offering tantalizing hints at the ongoings within.

From first sight to last, &law_city; whisks away newcomers and locals alike into an embrace of structure and control that seems almost caring. The city runs like clockwork, with each inhabitant and agency fulfilling a purpose in a timely and efficient manner. From the lowliest courier to the highest seats of government, every citizen of &law_city; is devoted fully to their cause. To do otherwise would be to invite certain scorn and disdain from one's peers.

Just as each citizen is devoted to their tasks, so is the city itself devoted to the law. Law is born and dies in &law_city;. Every agency houses its highest offices here in this locus of government power. Yet despite the proximity of government control, the city does not quake under the tyranny of authoritarianism. That the government serves its people is a well respected fact, and it is commonly understood that &law_city; only functions at the willing compliance of its citizens.
